page.title: 04Kington area-Farming aspects
page.content: In the Kington area there are several farms, mostly small family farms, ranging in size from 50 to 125 acres. Most farms rear sheep and cows. Sheep are sold to market as weaning lambs, fat lambs, hogs, yearlings, ewes or rams. Cattle are sold at 6-12 months or 12-18 months. There are a few dairy farms which sell their milk locally. One farm rears hens on a battery basis. Around June sheep are sheared. In winter the weather is bad with a lot of snow and the animals are hard to feed. Harvesting starts in June, when hay and silage are made. Root crops are also grown for sheep. Other crops grown include black currants and potatoes. Many local people pick and sort potatoes. One farm uses part of its land to process sewage and industrial waste.
